website_summaries.verdict: Metro is definitely the leading maker of computer vacuums and this DataVac model is a powerful but inexpensive version.
pros: Includes air pinpointer, air concentrator nozzle, air-flare nozzle, and a micro-cleaning-tool kit
Has a 12-foot power cord for easy maneuverability
cons: Very loud and gets hot fairly quickly, so most buyers use this in short spurts rather than long cleaning sessions

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: If you read the instructions and know what your buying, this is amazing. Most people are writing reviews complaining that it is too powerful, or it gets too hot, or it even starts smoking. This is all just user error. These people are not smart enough to read instructions. This product is NOT supposed to run for long periods of time. It is supposed to be turned on then off after a few seconds in short bursts. It is not meant to do a full house dusting, it is to quickly blow the dust off of your screens, electronics, maybe a ceiling fan. (extra bonus, blow bugs away). If the product is not used correctly that is the users fault.
customer_reviews.author: Courtland

customer_reviews.title: No more empty cans of air into the landfill.
customer_reviews.text: I love it and it will save me a ton of money in the long run. I have way to many computers and other associated devices in the house and buying canned air was really starting to add up to keep everything dusted out. This just the job just as well if not better. As a few others have said, it can be about as loud as a small vacuum cleaner and has to be plugged in but this doesn't bother me at all considering I no longer have to buy cans of air to throw into the landfill. The unit feels very sturdy and seems to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Riggs

customer_reviews.title: no more wasting money on air cans
customer_reviews.text: Pushes enough air as if you were using an air can. This does get hot, but in my experience i was able to clean out my whole computer before the device got super hot. Just let it cool for a while and use it again! I like that i can use it when i feel like it. With the air cans, i was always preserving them, because i didn't want to run out. In other words, great device, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Power to spare!
customer_reviews.text: This is no wimpy little blower. It's more than powerful enough to blow dust out of just about anything. It's about as powerful as my Kenmore canister vacuum cleaner, except it blows! I can even blow the curtains from across the room. Tried it out on my Dell desktop. Worked great. The attachments give you the option of attaching anything from a 1" diam nozzle to a 1/4" nozzle. I use it for everything I need to dust including my guitars. It's great for blowing the dust off the bridge and headstock areas. Wear a dust mask, you will need it.
customer_reviews.author: sati

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blowing power for a little machine
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this 4 stars is that my machine unit got very hot. The attachments are nice and I love that it gave you options. This machine has many uses. I have already used it to clean the inside of my tower as well as my keyboard. It will come in handy in all those hard to reach little nook and cranny areas around the house. This thing is super simple to use. Simply plug it in, attach whatever attachment you need on the end (just slides on) and flip the switch to power on the unit. I cannot attest to the longevity of the machine yet, but so far it's held up to multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: There is no suction
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this was an option for the review, this unit only blows, but that is why i got it. Does take a few seconds to get to full power, maybe 5, and then it really is about 90-95% the same as a can of air, but it doesn't lose pressure as time goes on. Great for PC and Laptop repair as well as i use is on my consoles. The attachments work great i love the on with the little brush on they end. Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Fresh N UNruly

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this Metro Vacuum 500P. The dust bunnies inside the CPU didn't stand a chance. Took about 30 seconds to blow the dust out. Much better than canned air. No moisture to worry about on the electronics. No need to be close to components., The burst of air will eliminate any dust inside the case from a distance. Cleaning the filter on the bottom is easy. I'm sure I will find other uses for this product as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA, works 1000x better than canned air.
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING REALLY BLOWS!!! I love this hand held hurricane, so far I've used it to blow out computers and electronics. If you like canned air, you will love this portable tornado. Made in USA, I really like their moto "Deliberately made better in the USA®". That right there sold me on the item. Cord is a nice length and the included attachments work well. If you are disappointed, you're not using it right.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: POwerful and noisy
customer_reviews.text: If you build your own PC's then maintaining it should always be mission #1. Theone thing you can do to prolong the life of a PC is to routinely clean out the dust and this little gem does so with zeal. It is a powerful little dust blower so expect it to be loud. Also, it heats up a little bit if you use it excessively long so please hold it by the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon E. Parker III

customer_reviews.title: If you have a neeed to dust out stuff this is the tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for work but have had one at home for at least the last 3-4 years and it's still going strong. The power of this thing makes those little air can dusters look like they are not even trying. This bad boy works like a charm for dusting out computers, keyboards and even cleaning the coils on AC units and anything else that needs dusting. My wife uses it to dust out her sewing machine and I also use it on my cars dashboard and numerous other things. Just remember to always check the little foam filter on the bottom, it can get clogged up with dust fairly easily and wear safety glasses.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This duster blows!
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows, hard. It does a very good job of blowing anything. Desktops, Laptops, Monitors, Ceiling Fans, Lamp, Animals, you name it, you can blow it. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone that's into this sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Whitman

customer_reviews.title: The best product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why "suction power" is one of the features that Amazon wants a rating on since this device doesn't do anything other than "blow air", but whatever, lol. Bottom line: These little devices are perfect for cleaning computer equipment or anything else that has fans, grates, grills, etc. I've been using these for years and just bought a second one recently.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Schuepbach

customer_reviews.title: Small but packs a real punch!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy one of the slightly cheaper wireless competitors but man I wish I didn’t even waste my time with that cheap junk. This is the real deal. It has a long enough cord to reach around my whole room. I use it to spray out all the dust in my desktop and my other computer peripherals, also to blow out my roomba hepa filters. It’s perfect for what I need it so I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Btncv

customer_reviews.title: I repair a lot of gaming systems and this thing blows the dust out way better than canned air
customer_reviews.text: This will save you so much money if you have any electronics. A can of air dust is 6-8 dollars and doesn't last very long. I repair a lot of gaming systems and this thing blows the dust out way better than canned air. It pays for itself very fast. I have no had any issues with messing up any electronics with this exact model. They do sell one that is certified for electronics its more expensive if your worried about frying something but like I said I have had no issues with that at all. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could've gotten one of these YEARS ago...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know these existed until we got one at work to blow out computers, as soon as I used it I knew I had to have one at home. It is great for getting dust out of hard-to-reach crevices but also surfaces that are difficult to vacuum or dust with a cloth, the air pressure is WAY stronger than those air cans or a vacuum on reverse will provide, on par with a small air compressor like you would inflate tires with.
customer_reviews.author: Meniscus

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best things I ever bought. I use it to clean out my computers and other electronics. For the more stuck on dust you just use a small soft brush and then hit it with the air. I also use it for cleaning my apartment. It blasts air out from behind cabinets and tower lamps and off of blinds and it doesn't run out and never accidentally blasts coolant on my stuff. It also does not lose pressure like canned air does. It's kind of a win win. Haven't bought canned air since I got this thing and never will again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Strausser

customer_reviews.title: Good product but loud and has a strong smell.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because we use quit a bit of the air duster cans at work. Although it provides a lot of air pressure, we find that the air duster cans are still a go to. The downsides of the unit are the noise (very loud) and smell that it puts out. Smells almost exactly like walking into a Northern Tool when you are done using it. Good product for many applications but not so much for what we do. I still would recommend the unit because I could see where it would have many useful applications.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene NCTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Can't say "it blows", but...
customer_reviews.text: I can't say it sucks, and I won't say it blows, but it really, really does blow! Very powerful! I only subtract 1 star for the noise level. The fact that you need to plug it in makes it less portable than canned air, but it will never run out, and it has a lot more power. If you want to move some dust, or Cheerios, or anything in a small area, get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: A must for those with sensitive electronics...and those who hate to dust
customer_reviews.text: A wee bit noisy....but I can live with the noise since it is so AWESOME. It comes with fixtures to make cleaning computers and all electronics easier....and, as mentioned....if you don't like to dust...just blow it away... We all vacuum every now and then....but dust can be seen...dust on carpets can't be seen....well...not unless you accumulate it. Anyway...this is a great item...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Benway

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: It works, but not as well as I thought it would. I find canned air to be much more effective for cleaning my computer. The device also gets hot very quickly when using the included attachments, so you can only use it for maybe 20-30 seconds before you have to let it cool down. Not only disappointed in the performance, but the smell it gives off is horrible. I've tried using it several times hoping that the smell would get better, but there's been no improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Must have for PC cleaning
customer_reviews.text: First: this is a duster, not a vacuum. So I didn't rate suction power. But it's blowing power is amazing. Second: this is a must have for cleaning PCs or keyboards. If you have never cleaned your PC; do it outside. This duster will get years of accumulated dust out of every crevice. You don't want the resulting dust cloud in your place.
customer_reviews.author: Kenja Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I have used it for everything from cleaning out computers to blowing out vacuum cleaner filters with great results. It is kind o
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated it beats the heck out of paying for canned air and is much more effective. I have used it for everything from cleaning out computers to blowing out vacuum cleaner filters with great results. It is kind of loud and it does get warm when run for a long time but not so bad I could not touch it. The different nozzle have been very handy. On the model I received the nozzles lock on. The 10 ft. cord is an added bonus The down side is the weight but that's a small thing considering how well it moves the dust . I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is not as powerful as the can air. If you turn the can upside down and pull the trigger such a full force of air comes out of the can it makes the item look ban new. With this gadget you can't do that. I find the dust still there. The can air blasts the dust away if you turn the can upside down. The item shines with no dust.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas F. Dandrea

customer_reviews.title: Been using for one year on my own PC and ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using for one year on my own PC and my roomate has been using on his as well. We haven't had any issues from statis electricity and that was our primary concern with this. They sell an ESD proof model, but doesn't appear to be needed. For clarification both my roomate and I have high end gaming desktops.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and compact blower
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and compact blower. Long flexible cord. I use it daily. Lasts about a year unless dropped. Once dropped, the steel case will bend and the motor won't spin and will burn out. Occasionally clean out the inlet filter pad located on the bottom of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: JohnO

customer_reviews.title: Metro Vacuum data Vac
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Data Vac ED500P Electric Duster on Oct. 20th, 2018 & absolutely loved it until today. The little plastic ring that hold the push button start piece broke in half today & now I cannot start the vac as the push start button just moves into the inner part of the vac. I went to the Metrovac website to look for parts/accessories but they do not list the part. I am hoping I can get a replacement ring before I give a 5 star rating of the vac. Thank you for your consideration in this matter. Steve Moser
customer_reviews.author: Spider1

customer_reviews.title: Way more powerful than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I expected the power of the air propulsion to be around 3 or 4 times as strong as a can of air. This feels like a leaf blower, and it surprised me when I plugged it in since the button was set to "on" before I did so. Big whoosh Very wow Much dust removes
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great, powerful, and Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. It's very powerful when you use whichever nozzle. It's heavy duty and has a 5 year warranty, I believe. I also talked to customer support when I first bought it and the tech guy was very helpful. Made in New Jersey. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Motors Burnt Up, Less than a Year Old, Warranty Difficulty
customer_reviews.text: I run an electronics repair center. I purchased two of these last year in July. They have decent power and definitely work when clean air is not needed. They are a little load but I do not care about that. They worked great for a while then late last year the motor burnt up on one of them. The guys went down to just the one and today the other one's motor burnt as well. Either they were not built to be used every day or I received two bad motors. They say they come with a 5-year warranty but I am finding it hard to locate where to send or return.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Apple

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blower.  Say Goodbye to Canned Air.
customer_reviews.text: This little blower is a great piece of equipment. I work with computers every day, and this thing makes canned air look like a relic of the past. Yeah, it's as loud as a household vacuum cleaner, but it doesn't lose power like a can of air does. I have also not had any problems with it getting too hot as some people report. The instructions note that prolonged use with the smaller attachments can cause overheating though. Still, this is a quality blower made in the US. I know I'll be using it to clean out dirty computers for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great portable air blower / duster
customer_reviews.text: This blower has been so helpful to me. I have a small woodshop and I use it every day. This blower clears all dust and wood chips from my work so I can add finish to the wood. It also blows off my work bench and projects during my work so I can better see my woodworking. When I am done, I will use the blower to clean my clothes of sawdust from my woodworking. This blower has greatly improved my work and cleanliness in my woodshop. I am very happy with this purchase. I wish I would have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Way better than compressed air.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy, and super effective at dusting things. Definitely a better purchase than getting a bunch of compressed air cans all the time. Honestly, if you have a PC and full set up, buy this thing, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Never looking at canned air again..
customer_reviews.text: This thing has so much power and I will probably never look at canned air again. pros: blows all the dust away can keep a constant pressure to loosen dust, unlike bursting from a can the attachments make it easy to blow into hard to reach spaces cons: can be loud can get hot after a while
customer_reviews.author: Jay K

customer_reviews.title: It's Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to keep my clippers clean while clipping my horse. It does a great job! I even use it to dust a very delicate floor lamp with a lot of crystals on it -- great at that too! Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: beesblues

customer_reviews.title: it's still freaking awesome. I love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Seeing the word vacuum, I thought it meant this had suction. It does not (that I'm aware of). That said, it's still freaking awesome. I love this little guy. It has cleaned the bejeesus out of my computer. Made in America! Also, dope family photo on the box of the Metro Vacuum family.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: You need to let it cool after a bit as the top of the case ...
customer_reviews.text: This works ok. It in general can replace canned air. It does get hot while running and the manufacturer does point this out. You need to let it cool after a bit as the top of the case gets uncomfortably hot. It seems to be well made and the case is all metal. It comes with several attachments that allow for directing the output. From small slit with a drinking straw size to large sweeping size cone with an opening of about 75 degrees and a width about .5 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device, and there is only one thing that would make it perfect and that would be if it was reversible into a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Javajolt

customer_reviews.title: Second Unit Was Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Metro Vac because canned air is expensive and doesn't work well for multiple computers. My work has hundreds of computers, so I wanted something better. The first unit came in less than a week bit only worked for a few seconds. I arranged for a return and got the second unit in two or three days. It worked like a champ. Good volume of air so it cleaned out dust quickly. We just made sure to not spin any fans. This will make future cleaning MUCH easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Tule991

customer_reviews.title: So Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This little blower is infinitely better then buying canned air. I love it! Its small easy to use and comes with multiple tips for different applications. I use it a lot for PC builds and other small electronic devices. I would totally recommend this to anybody in the IT/PC building fields. Its pays for itself when you think about how often you have to by compressed air cans. It can be used for so many applications and is handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: SaberXIV

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and exactly as described by seller. Much more convenient than using canned air where the Can gets cold quickly and loses it’s blowing power. This is great for blowing the dust out of your electronics, or doing a quick dusting job before guests arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good unit with some negatives
customer_reviews.text: For the price I would expect that the tools can come off easier than they do, a small case to put the unit in and a cord that is a bit more forgiving. Overall this is an absolute buy but do this product will be topped by a 2.0 model that addresses these issues. If you are going to pay a premium then it should be a premium product. As of now it is a good product. The noise is also not something to forget. Do no use under a desk or in a network closet without ear protection.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: If you don't mind the noise this is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It is noisy, and it gets warm with continuous use, I've not keep it on for so long it goes hot, but it does blow air with good strength to blow all the dust away. I will still complain about the noise though.
customer_reviews.author: Osimo

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful device
customer_reviews.text: I'm having lots of fun with this mini-duster. Airflow is surprisingly forceful, and it's ideal for blowing dust out of keyboards and electronic devices. You can even use it for household chores, such as removing dust from bookshelves or other locations where a conventional vacuum-cleaner won't reach. Dust tends to accumulate quickly on the small intake filter, but you can clean the filter without removing it.
customer_reviews.author: Julian3

customer_reviews.title: This just works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give to my daughter. The one I have is the same as this and I've used it every day for over 5 years now. I've dropped quite a few times from 4 feet high but it still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Penduko

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to air out my computer (Mac Pro) of dust because strange fan noises were emanating from it. The blower has sufficient power to effectively clean the computer of dust and debris. I don't think the blower is as strong as compressed air, but it remains effective (if loud). The company gets kudos from me for being based in the United States and the vacuum being manufactured here! I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Surber

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful for such a small size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad and he loves it. We have two cats and he loves to use it to blow the furs out of our home. Its very loud(obviously) and very powerful for a small blower.
customer_reviews.author: S.EJ

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful blower!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this blower for years at my work and decided to finally buy one for myself at home. The power of the air is amazing and I’m glad I’ll never have to buy canned air again. The attachments are all very helpful too!
customer_reviews.author: GParks14

customer_reviews.title: Nice purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use this unit specifically to dry off items I clean in the ultrasonic cleaner prior to lubrication. Works great and you'll save a ton of money vs. buying compress air.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Device
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is all metal...heavy duty. It pumps out air at a high rate and does the job blowing out the dust in my computer and out of the wall heaters.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, where has this been?
customer_reviews.text: This is just one of those products that you pick up, use to clean out three computers, two keyboards, a SNES, a ceiling fan, all your furniture, an AC filter, and use to make funny faces with for Instagram, then wonder how you even tied your shoes without it. If you build, service, own, or just look at computers occasionally, or if you've ever compared dusting to flossing, get one. The small brush attachment is useless when mounted on the cleaner, but it works double-time as a capacitive stylus and an ESD-safe brush if you're properly grounded.
customer_reviews.author: Birds

customer_reviews.title: Dusty Trail
customer_reviews.text: First time I started the thing up, I was amazed. It's a little noisy but it really does the job of cleaning out the Dust out of my Computer. This is really great. No more canned air!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dail

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate duster!
customer_reviews.text: Best compressed air tool ever! Worked great on my PC, laptops, and game consoles! The dust that escaped my Macbook Pro (unibody) when I used this was unbelievable! I couldn't believe how much collected in there, you think I lived in a chimney or something. Also helped clear my old PS3 fat of dust and in turn kept it much cooler (overheating issues). You'll never buy cans of compressed air again from an office store after you use this baby! Totally recommend getting one if you have any electronics you ant to clear of dust and debris.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Sealy

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quick and smells a bit but it's not an inconvenience. Probably one of the best investments I've made. It does tend to blow air through the sides when attachments are attached though. Would recommends getting an ESD wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie B.

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like odor - Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: 1) It blows air out as intended 2) It heats up on brief usage (>6mins) 3) Air blows out from the sides (intended) 4) It reeks. If you are sensitive to odor, do not buy this item. It emits a very mechanical odor while in use and it lingers in the room if you use it inside. If you decide to buy it anyway, I recommend taking items outside and using this to dust it with... otherwise, be warned that the smell is powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Heats up a great deal but all in all I have to say ...
customer_reviews.text: Heats up a great deal but all in all I have to say it accomplishes exactly what I wanted and has saved me money from buying compressed cans. It's pretty powerful and easy to use. I personally improve the button better, maybe rather than a button a gun trigger would be more comfortable. Handling it is easy and the cord is long but gets in the way though going for something battery-operated would likely be heavier and would run out of juice pretty quickly. All in all it does it's job and I was happily surprised
customer_reviews.author: Nar

customer_reviews.title: Great Blower!
customer_reviews.text: Cleans like a pro. Gets hot while running longer than a minute. Best purchase to save my computer desktop from spiderwebs and human skin flakes.
customer_reviews.author: Stone

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, just get one already...
customer_reviews.text: Quit wasting your money on canned air!! Not only does this thing work wonderfully at removing dust from your electronics, it also works to blow water off your car after a wash! Protip: the smallest tip will make the motor get hot faster than the bigger ones. Not sure what the duty cycle is on this thing. If you have issues with having your blow jobs being a tad loud, then this may not be for you. Otherwise, it works like a dream! Just get one already! Do it. Do it now.
customer_reviews.author: T4rkus

customer_reviews.title: Great device for replacing canned air
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the cans of air that I really disliked using. Nothing worse than trying to clean something and the can would get so cold that ice formed on the outside and it lost most of it's pressure till it warmed up again. This unit works fantastic. I recommended it to our lighting person at church and they bought one. Cleaned out the dimmer packs for the church lighting and told me it worked perfect. It does sound like a vacuum cleaner but it won't loose pressure and you will never have to buy a can of air again.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny 5

customer_reviews.title: This thing is powerful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time around the house because it's so powerful. Mostly for de-dusting woodworking projects. This thing is really built well, but the only thing I would mention if you purchased one is don't use it over say a minute or so at one time. Let it cool for a minute, use it for a minute if needed. It's so powerful it will burn the motor up....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid blower vac, made on purpose in the USA!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to be said about this blower vac, other than it is AWESOME! MetroVac is a U.S based company that makes all their products right here in the USA!!! It is a well built product, with a lot of steel. It has a great, powerful motor (a tad noisy though, so don't be surprised). The whole thing seems to be well made. No more canned air and the toxic aerosol gasses involved with those! I use this for my computer repair company. It is nice to just take it to customer homes or business's and blow out equipment. Plus, the customers are impressed with it too!
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Having worked at GameStop for almost 10 years, I've gone through a few of these. Out of all the brands, this was the best working one and longest lasting one. Had to buy one for my personal use and now I use it to easily clean and dust all my electronics. PCs, consoles, arcade sticks, and even some of my statuettes
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Nasty

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Just buy it. Its fun.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Loud but amazing lol. Its got all the power you would need. Find it more useful without attachments... The little hose attachment.. Kind of just kills the power it end up kind of blowing back into itself rather then focusing the power.. But even without anything hooking to it.. It will blow out a key board just fine unless you got some really nasty bits caught in small areas. Beware of it blowing the crap out of everything on your desk. Fun with too spook you cats and 2 year old toddler with! You could totally use this as a small leaf blower. For my needs. Worth. No more buying compressed air! woot.
customer_reviews.author: HarleeKills

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting much but this thing got some power! It's much stronger than a regular can duster. And you don't have to worry about it running out!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful Air Stream
customer_reviews.text: I do not consider this a "vacuum" as it does not have suction capability. It is an incredibly strong air blower that exceeded my expectations. The power cord is very long, which means you do not have to be that close to the electric outlet. I use it to dust off my computer and lap[top keyboards-it gets rid of all of the "stuff" that, somehow, gets between the keys. It Because of its power, caution needs to be used when dusting delicate items as they will go flying in the stream of air.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Blows hard. And you want that.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for work. Moves a lot of air and clears a lot of dust. Hundreds of times better than canned air. The attachments are pretty cool too. I use the one that looks like a bendy straw to get behind switches and blow their fans out without unmounting them.
customer_reviews.author: Big Shane

customer_reviews.title: This little thing works great - much better (and cheaper
customer_reviews.text: This little thing works great - much better (and cheaper, in the long run) than compressed air. We use it for computer equipment, to clean out my sewing machines...all kinds of stuff. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: WebDevMom

customer_reviews.title: DataVac
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have one around. Small, easy to handle. Good little attachments. Great for blowing out a PC once a month too.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckM

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: I gotta be honest. it almost flew out of my hand when i first used it. Never buy canned air again.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: Does it well
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job well great for dusting PC's, keyboards, car dash, anything with small details as long as it's not delicate a little loud could use a speed setting
customer_reviews.author: gyracso

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME AND POWERFUL. BUT DANGEROUS IF YOU TRY TO SCREW IT TIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: It does really good job of blow off dust. I really like how powerful it is. But sometimes around the screws that untightended have some powder coming out. And when I try to screw it. The screw get in the spinner and it create noisy sound and flame smile. So I screw back in order to get back to normal, SO DO NOT TRY TO SCREW THIS THING!!! YOU WILL BREAK IT.
customer_reviews.author: mino

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Duster
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful duster that pays for itself. However it is loud like a mini vacuum cleaner and I looked at some Youtube videos before making my decision that this thing is powerful and will blow the dust and debris out of small crevices. Definitely better than the canned air dusters. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Darrin S.

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than cans of compressed air and much cheaper over time.
customer_reviews.text: So far has saved me lots of dollars. Great idea. Be careful running for too long though. I start to smell electricity if I don't take breaks while running it. Still will run for much longer while producing more pressure than a can of compressed air. With cans you do short bursts and alternate between cans in order to keep pressure up. With this I would recommend 30 second intervals with 5 second breaks. Just my thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Blower
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me and you want to get away from all the expensive canned air products on the market, than I suggest you look into getting a Metro Vacuum DataVac. In a nut shell, these are the high points: 1) Heavy duty but somewhat loud, which isn't a problem. Most household vacuum cleaners are much louder. 2) Well made 3) Simple on/off switch 4) Comes with several easy to install attachments 5) Plenty of velocity for blowing off my computer and other equipment, tools, etc.
customer_reviews.author: jrc1419

customer_reviews.title: MUCH Better Than Using Canned Air!
customer_reviews.text: This Dust Vacuum is easy to use, easy to clean the filter and provides safe air to use when blowing dust from clocks and other dedicates. It also beats having to try to find safe canned air to use.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to do everything from dusting off slides/negatives or blowing the dust out from by base board heaters. If the noise were quieter I would give it a five star rating - I my house I can't use it when I work late into the night in my office. Otherwise - this machine is near flawless. I can sacrifice my needs for the noise. If you need this device then you should ignore the noise too!
customer_reviews.author: jmksi001

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and pushes a LOT of air!
customer_reviews.text: A MUST have. It will cut down the cost of blowing out your computer or other peripherals. It absolutely replaces the 'spray cans of air' I used to have to purchase. Not only does this save money and pay for itself, it is powerful. You practically can cool yourself off on a hot summwer day with this blower, not suggesting you do that, but just illustrating how good this blower is. The blower is sturdy and a must have for you maintenance needs.
customer_reviews.author: Practicedummy

customer_reviews.title: It works as stated!
customer_reviews.text: I use the ED500P almost daily at home for many tasks. Even for cleaning the bird cage! No complaints so far about if it gets hot, is too heavy, the cord is too short, is noisy, doesn't says hello to me when I wake up and so on. Buy it and test it for yourself. My only complaint was the cost of shipping and handling; rather expensive ($12.00) for a normal delivery, no rush, from the maker in NH. However, the package arrived before I expected. Beware, it's not a vacuum. It's a blower. I appreciate the fact that it's built in America for Americans.
customer_reviews.author: Fx May

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Wish it was a little more powerful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I got tired of firing up my huge air compressor just to do a quick blowout of my electronics. Works great. Wish it was a little more powerful, but it definitely moves enough air to clean out all electronics I've used it on.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great compact blower. Now I don't have to use the leaf blower in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and powerful. Easy to use and has good amount of necessary extras for finer cleaning. Saved me on purchasing cold spray cans that do not do much and has alot of waste. Any PC owner needs this necessary cleaner. Can be used to clean other electronics as well.
customer_reviews.author: Southflip

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to clean our electronics and gaming systems instead of buying canned air constantly. It works great. So much better than canned air. I would say it's definitely worth the price if you use duster a lot. It does a great job and getting the nooks and crannies clear without damaging things. We don't have as need for all of the attachments most of the time, but they are great to have on hand for certain things.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful blower for its size
customer_reviews.text: I was caught off guard when I turned the unit on. It actually torqued in my hand, very powerful. Strong motor, strong output. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: mpklaus

customer_reviews.title: Metro Vaccuum DataVac Doesn't Suck - Literally
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows out dust like nobody's business. You need to wear hearing protection when using this for more than about a minute (seriously, you will get hearing damage, ask OSHA). It does get hot after a few minutes especially with the finer nozzles, but have you ever felt how hot your vacuum cleaner's motor gets? This is basically a vacuum cleaner motor in a can.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Newell

customer_reviews.title: This DataVac is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This DataVac is awesome!!! Very pleased and works great!!! I used one of them when I was working as a computer tech and it worked os good, I bought myself one after I retired. I would invest in one of these b4 I would purchase a dozen of the Blow Off cans to keep my computer clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Ball

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective ones in a row
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it had very weak nozzle pressure. Leaked air between where the screws hold the 2 housings together. Returned it and ordered a second to give them one more chance and of course it had the exact same problem. Fool me twice, shame on me. Manufacturer is too inept to test the units for even one second before shipping them. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: D. DeMar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome item
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is the best investment I have in such a long time, it's a bit loud but it's worth every penny. Take from me u will savealot of money.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This machine is amazing you will definitely won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Juan Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Much better than canned air
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing! Purchased for my grooming shop to blow the hair out of my clipper blades and all the shop electronics. It works great to blow the hair out from under the tables before vacuuming as well. We use it several times a day. Much better than canned air.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuits

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this thing would be weaker than canned air. The first time i turned it on, it made an unholy mess, scattering everything on my desk. Any more power and it could double as a leaf blower. Very happy i bought this powerful little puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Albert S. Bessinger

customer_reviews.title: Its very good quality actually
customer_reviews.text: Its very good quality actually, seems made well and is made in the USA which is a plus. My only qualm is the small hole that leaks air out of the nozzle, seems like you would want an enclosed system to increase air pressure. Nonetheless it blows hard and dusted out my PC case well, gonna try it on the keyboard next. Overall i would definitely buy again and would recommend this brand/device to family. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows!
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows. I wish I would have gotten it years ago way better than canned air.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and tested it out. So far it is fantastic. Exactly what I needed. I spent a fortune on compressed air for my computers, keyboards and radio control vehicles. Now I can blow dust out and not feel like every second pressed is cash spent. Great investment for me. It is plenty strong and feels well built. I like the metal body, I feel like it will last.
customer_reviews.author: JennRated

customer_reviews.title: Not an air can, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: It does its job well, but focused pressure is not as good as what you get from a compressed air can. Using the straw extension is a must! Don't let this deter you though, it's a fine product. I can now get the same job done without an air can because of this. It comes out to a lot of saved money in the long run. Air cans are expensive and wasteful!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Malone

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think, buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have made in a long time. So long compressed air.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymes

customer_reviews.title: Great, but Loud
customer_reviews.text: I work on a lot of computers and this little duster has paid for itself in the amount of canned air I used to buy. The attachments allow to clean inside and outside the computer. It does wonders on printers and copying machines as well! The one big complaint I have is that this thing is LOUD. There's no using this in an office setting without angering a bunch of co-workers with the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Bifrost

customer_reviews.title: Blows!
customer_reviews.text: 100 times better than the Hurricane brand. Blows a lot of dust out of keyboards and computers. Save a lot of money by purchasing this than canned air.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome

customer_reviews.title: It will be better if it can adjust the power level
customer_reviews.text: gets hot really fast if you use the smaller header
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Who you gonna call?  Electric Duster!
customer_reviews.text: The Electric Duster helps blow away all the dust inside of my computers, keeps the motherboard, cpu and fans clean. While blowing, I use a vacuum cleaner hose to suck the dust in, all while doing this in the garage. I've seen someone just use an extension cord and blow the dust outside in there yard. The bottom portion does seem to get hot sometimes, and that is when I turn it off. Great product :)
customer_reviews.author: Daddys Best

customer_reviews.title: Blows air, good canned air replacement.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these at work and I was blown away at how well it worked. This thing is far more effective at blowing out dust compared to canned air with looses its pressure and flow after a few seconds of use. This thing will blow out an entire computer in half the time compared to using 4 cans of air. This in the long run will save a lot of money and prevent (at least us) from adding to the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Rolaids0

customer_reviews.title: It actually blows.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be mislead by the title. It's not a vacuum so much as it is an electronic duster. It came as shown with all the attachments. I used it the day I got it to clean out my computer and keyboard. I did see a lot of dust flying out of them. It isn't quite as powerful as the Hurricane canless air systems, but it does get the job done. You do have to have it plugged in for it to work, but that really shouldn't be an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Omega Plan

product_meta.title: Metro Vacuum ED500P DataVac 500-Watt, 0.75-HP Electric Duster
product_meta.description:
Size:Оne РасkFROM THE MANUFACTURER
This newest addition to Metro's proven DataVac line has been completely redesigned from the ground-up. It is much more compact and comfortable to use than previous models and features a new, almost unbelievably powerful 500-Watt motor that literally blasts dust, dirt and debris off expensive computer/electronic equipment to keep it running at peak efficiency. The new DataVac Electric Duster is positioned as a "greener", more effective and cost-efficient alternative to the controversial "canned air" products currently dominating the category.ED500P in plain corrugated remailer carton.
feature_bullets: 500 watt motor, .75 HP, 120 volt, 4.5 amps, 70 CFM air flow, weights 2.75 lbs.Packaging: Plain Remailer Carton
Includes air pin-pointer, air concentrator nozzle, air -flare nozzle and micro-cleaning tool kit, 12 ft power cord
More economical than canned air, and safer than canned air

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars713 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
